title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, colour, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behaviour contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behaviour include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others‚Äô private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement davison.jack.jd@gmail.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behaviour deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behaviour inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behaviour. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behaviour. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla‚Äôs code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to worldmet
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ‚Äôll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to worldmet
text: want make bigger change, ‚Äôs good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ‚Äôs needed. ‚Äôve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex.

title: Contributing to worldmet
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven‚Äôt done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("openair-project/worldmet", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn‚Äôt pass cleanly, ‚Äôs good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e.¬†just first header).

title: Contributing to worldmet
text: Care taken new code follows style similar rest openair worldmet. user-facing example exported functions written ‚ÄúlowerCamelCase‚Äù (.e., polarMap() rather polar_map()). use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation.

title: Contributing to worldmet
text: Please note worldmet project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Using {worldmet} to Locate, Import & Visualise Meteorological Data

Click expand markers find site interest (shown blue marker), can clicked information. important information revealed marker station ID, used access data.
code: import_ghcn_stations() #> # A tibble: 34,181 √ó 11 #>    id    name  country state network   lat   lng elevation gsn_flag hcn_crn_flag #>    <chr> <chr> <chr>   <chr> <chr>   <dbl> <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>    <chr>        #>  1 AAI0‚Ä¶ REIN‚Ä¶ AA      NA    I        12.5 -70.0      18.3 NA       NA           #>  2 ACL0‚Ä¶ BARB‚Ä¶ AC      TX    L        17.6 -61.8       5   NA       NA           #>  3 ACM0‚Ä¶ COOL‚Ä¶ AC      NA    M        17.1 -61.8      10   NA       NA           #>  4 ACU5‚Ä¶ SOMB‚Ä¶ AC      NA    U        18.6 -63.5      10   NA       NA           #>  5 ACU5‚Ä¶ SOMB‚Ä¶ AC      NA    U        18.6 -63.5      12   NA       NA           #>  6 ACU5‚Ä¶ SOMB‚Ä¶ AC      NA    U        18.6 -63.5      14   NA       NA           #>  7 ACU5‚Ä¶ SOMB‚Ä¶ AC      NA    U        18.6 -63.5      16   NA       NA           #>  8 ACU5‚Ä¶ SOMB‚Ä¶ AC      NA    U        18.6 -63.5       9   NA       NA           #>  9 ACW0‚Ä¶ ST J‚Ä¶ AC      NA    W        17.1 -61.8      19.2 NA       NA           #> 10 AEI0‚Ä¶ ABU ‚Ä¶ AE      NA    I        24.4  54.7      26.8 NA       NA           #> # ‚Ñπ 34,171 more rows #> # ‚Ñπ 1 more variable: wmo_id <chr> import_ghcn_stations(return = "map")

title: Using {worldmet} to Locate, Import & Visualise Meteorological Data
text: obtain data user must supply station ID year(s) interest. example, download data Heathrow Airport 2024 (ID UKI0000EGLL): wind rose (example) can easily plotted using openair:
code: met_london <- import_ghcn_hourly("UKI0000EGLL", year = 2025) head(met_london) #> # A tibble: 6 √ó 44 #>   id          station  date                  lat    lng  elev air_temp dew_temp #>   <chr>       <chr>    <dttm>              <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 UKI0000EGLL HEATHROW 2024-01-01 00:00:00  51.5 -0.461  25.3      8.1      5.3 #> 2 UKI0000EGLL HEATHROW 2024-01-01 00:20:00  51.5 -0.461  25.3      8        5   #> 3 UKI0000EGLL HEATHROW 2024-01-01 00:50:00  51.5 -0.461  25.3      8        4   #> 4 UKI0000EGLL HEATHROW 2024-01-01 01:00:00  51.5 -0.461  25.3      7.8      4.8 #> 5 UKI0000EGLL HEATHROW 2024-01-01 01:20:00  51.5 -0.461  25.3      8        4   #> 6 UKI0000EGLL HEATHROW 2024-01-01 01:50:00  51.5 -0.461  25.3      8        4   #> # ‚Ñπ 36 more variables: atmos_pres <dbl>, sea_pres <dbl>, wd <dbl>, ws <dbl>, #> #   wg <dbl>, precip <dbl>, rh <dbl>, wet_bulb <dbl>, wx_mw1 <chr>, #> #   wx_mw2 <chr>, wx_mw3 <chr>, wx_au1 <chr>, wx_au2 <chr>, wx_au3 <chr>, #> #   wx_aw1 <chr>, wx_aw2 <chr>, wx_aw3 <chr>, snow_depth <dbl>, #> #   visibility <dbl>, altimeter <dbl>, pres_03 <dbl>, sc_1 <chr>, #> #   sc_baseht_1 <dbl>, sc_2 <chr>, sc_baseht_2 <dbl>, sc_3 <chr>, #> #   sc_baseht_3 <dbl>, precip_03 <dbl>, precip_06 <dbl>, precip_09 <dbl>, ‚Ä¶ # use function from openair openair::windRose(met_london)

title: Using {worldmet} to Locate, Import & Visualise Meteorological Data
text: Also available worldmet : import_ghcn_daily(), imports daily average data. Users may select specific stations, available years station downloaded. import_ghcn_monthly_temp(), imports monthly average temperatures entire GHCN. import_ghcn_monthly_prcp(), imports monthly total precipitation specific stations. Outside GHCN, worldmet gives access historic Integrated Surface Database (ISD), functions: import_isd_stations() obtain metadata, import_isd_hourly() import_isd_lite() obtain measurement data.

title: Using {worldmet} to Locate, Import & Visualise Meteorological Data
text: Two functions made available writing imported data uses. write_met() write short-term data imported GHCN ISD individual files (either delimited, RDS, parquet files) split year monitoring station. write_adms() write (present) ISD data format compatible Atmospheric Dispersion Modelling System (ADMS).

title: Import Surface Meteorological Data from NOAA Integrated Surface Database (ISD)
text: worldmet small handful core functionality. Access metadata using import_ghcn_stations(). Import monitoring data using import_ghcn_hourly(). Data format ready use , example, openair::windRose(). Write files ADMS format using write_adms().

TRUE linear interpolation carried gaps including maxgap. maxgap maximum gap hours interpolated missing data interp = TRUE. Data gaps maxgap left missing.

title: Deprecated ISD access functions ‚Äî getMeta
text: function part old worldmet API. Please use following alternatives: getMeta() -> import_isd_stations() getMetaLive() -> import_isd_stations_live() importNOAA() -> import_isd_hourly() importNOAAlite() -> import_isd_lite() path argument -> write_met()

title: Deprecated ISD access functions ‚Äî getMeta
code: getMeta(   site = NULL,   lat = NULL,   lon = NULL,   crs = 4326,   country = NULL,   state = NULL,   n = 10,   end.year = "current",   provider = c("OpenStreetMap", "Esri.WorldImagery"),   plot = TRUE,   returnMap = FALSE )  getMetaLive(...)  importNOAA(   code = "037720-99999",   year = 2014,   hourly = TRUE,   source = c("delim", "fwf"),   quiet = FALSE,   path = NA,   n.cores = NULL )  importNOAAlite(code = "037720-99999", year = 2025, quiet = FALSE, path = NA)

title: Deprecated ISD access functions ‚Äî getMeta
text: site site name search string e.g. site = "heathrow". search strings partial can upper lower case e.g. site = "HEATHR". lat, lon Decimal latitude longitude (Y/X coordinate using different crs). provided, n_max closest ISD stations coordinate returned. crs coordinate reference system (CRS) data, passed sf::st_crs(). default EPSG:4326, CRS associated commonly used latitude longitude coordinates. Different coordinate systems can specified using crs (e.g., crs = 27700 British National Grid). Note non-lat/lng coordinate systems re-projected EPSG:4326 making comparisons NOAA metadata plotting map. country country code. two letter code. full listing see https://www1.ncdc.noaa.gov/pub/data/noaa/isd-history.csv. state state code. two letter code. n number nearest sites search based latitude longitude. end.year help filter sites based recent available data . end.year can "current", "" numeric year 2016, range years e.g. 1990:2016 (select site end date range. default sites data current year returned. provider default map created readers may toggle vector base map satellite/aerial image. provider allows users override default; see http://leaflet-extras.github.io/leaflet-providers/preview/ list base maps can used. multiple base maps provided, can toggled using "layer control" interface. plot TRUE plot sites interactive leaflet map. returnMap leaflet map returned instead meta data? Default FALSE. ... Currently unused. code identifying code character string. code combination USAF WBAN unique identifiers. codes separated ‚Äú-‚Äù e.g. code = "037720-99999". year year import. can vector years e.g. year = 2000:2005. hourly hourly means calculated? default TRUE. FALSE raw data returned. source NOAA ISD service stores files two formats; delimited CSV files ("delim") fixed width files ("fwf"). import_isd_hourly() defaults "delim" , delimited data store , users may wish try "fwf" instead. data sources identical one another. quiet Print missing sites/years screen? Defaults FALSE. path file path provided, data saved rds file chosen location e.g.  path = "C:/Users/David". Files saved year site. n.cores longer recommended; please set mirai::daemons() R session. argument provided back compatibility, passed n argument mirai::daemons() behalf user. set daemons reset function completes. Default NULL, means parallelism. n.cores = 1L equivalent n.cores = NULL.

title: Deprecated ISD access functions ‚Äî getMeta
text: data frame returned available meta data, mostly importantly including code can supplied importNOAA(). latitude longitude searches made approximate distance, dist km also returned.

what: Import data from the Global Historical Climatology hourly (GHCNh) database ‚Äî import_ghcn_hourly
title: Import data from the Global Historical Climatology hourly (GHCNh) database ‚Äî import_ghcn_hourly
text: function flexibly accesses meteorological data GHCNh database. Users can provide number years stations, fully control sorts data flag codes returned data. default, column names shortened easier use R, longer, descriptive names can requested.

title: Import data from the Global Historical Climatology hourly (GHCNh) database ‚Äî import_ghcn_hourly
code: import_ghcn_hourly(   station = "UKI0000EGLL",   year = NULL,   source = c("psv", "parquet"),   hourly = TRUE,   extra = FALSE,   abbr_names = TRUE,   append_codes = FALSE,   codes = c("measurement_code", "quality_code", "report_type", "source_code",     "source_id"),   progress = rlang::is_interactive() )

title: Import data from the Global Historical Climatology hourly (GHCNh) database ‚Äî import_ghcn_hourly
text: station One site codes station(s) interest, obtained using import_ghcn_stations(). year One years interest. NULL, default, years data available chosen stations imported. source two identical data formats read - "psv" (flat, pipe-delimited files) "parquet" (newer, faster, columnar format). latter typically faster, requires arrow package additional dependency. Note applies year NULL; -site files psv files. hourly hourly means calculated? default TRUE. FALSE raw data returned, can sub-hourly. extra additional columns returned? default, FALSE, returns opinionated selection elements 'll interest users. TRUE return everything available GHCNh. abbr_names column names abbreviated? TRUE, default, columns like "wind_direction" shortened "wd". FALSE, names match raw data, albeit lower case. append_codes Logical. various codes (e.g., measurement coeds, qualiy codes, etc.) appended output dataframe? codes append_codes TRUE, codes appended dataframe? combination "measurement_code", "quality_code", "report_type", "source_code", /"source_id". progress Show progress bar importing many stations/years? Defaults TRUE interactive R sessions. Passed .progress purrr::map() /purrr::pmap().

text: function convenient way access monthly summaries GHCN. Monthly average temperature available via import_ghcn_monthly_temp() monthly precipitation via import_ghcn_monthly_prcp(). Note functions can take minutes run.

title: Import data from the Global Historical Climatology monthly (GHCNm) database ‚Äî import_ghcn_monthly_temp
code: import_ghcn_monthly_temp(   table = c("inventory", "data"),   dataset = c("qcu", "qcf", "qfe") )  import_ghcn_monthly_prcp(   station = NULL,   table = c("inventory", "data"),   progress = rlang::is_interactive() )

title: Import data from the Global Historical Climatology monthly (GHCNm) database ‚Äî import_ghcn_monthly_temp
text: table Either "inventory", "data", . tables read return output list. dataset import_ghcn_monthly_temp(). One options. information available https://www.ncei.noaa.gov/pub/data/ghcn/v4/readme.txt. "qcu": Quality Control, Unadjusted "qcf": Quality Control, Adjusted, using Pairwise Homogeneity Algorithm. "qfe": Quality Control, Adjusted, Estimated using Pairwise Homogeneity Algorithm. years 1961-2010 provided. help maximize station coverage calculating normals. station import_ghcn_monthly_prcp(). specific stations import monthly precipitation data . progress import_ghcn_monthly_prcp(). Show progress bar importing many stations? Defaults TRUE interactive R sessions. Passed .progress purrr::map().

code: import_ghcn_stations(   name = NULL,   country = NULL,   state = NULL,   lat = NULL,   lng = NULL,   crs = 4326,   n_max = 10L,   database = c("hourly", "daily"),   return = c("table", "sf", "map") )

title: Import station metadata for the Global Historical Climatology Network ‚Äî import_ghcn_stations
text: name, country, state String values use filter metadata specific site names, countries states. country state matched exactly codes accessed using import_ghcn_countries(). name searched sub-string case insensitively. lat, lng, n_max Decimal latitude (lat) longitude (lng) (Y/X coordinate using different crs). provided, n_max closest ISD stations coordinate returned. crs coordinate reference system (CRS) data, passed sf::st_crs(). default EPSG:4326, CRS associated commonly used latitude longitude coordinates. Different coordinate systems can specified using crs (e.g., crs = 27700 British National Grid). Note non-lat/lng coordinate systems re-projected EPSG:4326 making comparisons NOAA metadata. database One "hourly" "daily", defines whether import stations available GHCNh GHCNd. Note overlap two, stations may available one . return type R object import GHCN stations . One following: "table", returns R data.frame. "sf", returns spatial data.frame sf package. "map", returns interactive leaflet map.

what: Import Meteorological data from the NOAA Integrated Surface Database (ISD) ‚Äî import_isd_hourly
title: Import Meteorological data from the NOAA Integrated Surface Database (ISD) ‚Äî import_isd_hourly
text: main function import data NOAA Integrated Surface Database (ISD). ISD contains detailed surface meteorological data around world 30,000 locations. general information ISD see https://www.ncei.noaa.gov/products/land-based-station/integrated-surface-database map https://gis.ncdc.noaa.gov/maps/ncei.

title: Import Meteorological data from the NOAA Integrated Surface Database (ISD) ‚Äî import_isd_hourly
code: import_isd_hourly(   code = "037720-99999",   year = 2014,   hourly = TRUE,   source = c("delim", "fwf"),   progress = rlang::is_interactive(),   quiet = FALSE )

title: Import Meteorological data from the NOAA Integrated Surface Database (ISD) ‚Äî import_isd_hourly
text: code identifying code character string. code combination USAF WBAN unique identifiers. codes separated ‚Äú-‚Äù e.g. code = "037720-99999". year year import. can vector years e.g. year = 2000:2005. hourly hourly means calculated? default TRUE. FALSE raw data returned. source NOAA ISD service stores files two formats; delimited CSV files ("delim") fixed width files ("fwf"). import_isd_hourly() defaults "delim" , delimited data store , users may wish try "fwf" instead. data sources identical one another. progress Show progress bar importing many stations/years? Defaults TRUE interactive R sessions. Passed .progress purrr::map() /purrr::pmap(). quiet Print missing sites/years screen? Defaults FALSE.

title: Import Meteorological data from the NOAA Integrated Surface Database (ISD) ‚Äî import_isd_hourly
text: Returns data frame surface observations. data frame consistent use openair package. Note data returned GMT (UTC) time zone format. Users may wish express data time zones, e.g., merge air pollution data.

title: Import Meteorological data from the NOAA Integrated Surface Database (ISD) ‚Äî import_isd_hourly
text: Note following units main variables: date Date/time POSIXct format. Note time zone GMT (UTC) may need adjusted merge local data. See details . latitude Latitude decimal degrees (-90 90). longitude Longitude decimal degrees (-180 180). Negative numbers west Greenwich Meridian. elevation Elevation site metres. wd Wind direction degrees. 90 east. ws Wind speed m/s. ceil_hgt height ground level (AGL) lowest cloud obscuring phenomena layer aloft 5/8 summation total sky cover, may predominantly opaque, vertical visibility surface-based obstruction. visibility visibility metres. air_temp Air temperature degrees Celcius. dew_point dew point temperature degrees Celcius. atmos_pres sea level pressure millibars. RH relative humidity (%). cl_1,  ...,  cl_3 Cloud cover different layers Oktas (1-8). cl Maximum cl_1 cl_3 cloud cover Oktas (1-8). cl_1_height, ..., cl_3_height Height cloud base later metres. precip_12 12-hour precipitation mm. sum column give annual precipitation. precip_6 6-hour precipitation mm. precip value precipitation spreads 12-hour total across previous 12 hours. pwc description present weather description (available). data returned GMT (UTC). may necessary adjust time zone combining data. example, air quality data available Beijing time zone set "Etc/GMT-8" (note negative offset even though Beijing ahead GMT. See openair package manual details), time zone met data can changed . One way attr(met$date, "tzone") <- "Etc/GMT-8" meteorological data frame called met. two data sets merged based date.

title: Import Meteorological data from the NOAA Integrated Surface Database (ISD) ‚Äî import_isd_hourly
text: importing lot meteorological data, can take long . combination year station requires downloading separate data file NOAA's online data directory, time download takes can quickly add . import_isd_hourly() import_isd_lite() can use parallel processing speed downloading , powered capable {mirai} package. users {mirai} "daemons" set, functions download files parallel. greatest benefits seen spawn many daemons cores machine, although one fewer available cores often good rule thumb. mileage may vary, however, naturally spawning daemons station-year combinations lead diminishing returns.
code: # set workers - once per session mirai::daemons(4)  # import lots of data - NB: no change in import_isd_hourly()! big_met <- import_isd_hourly(code = "037720-99999", year = 2010:2020)

title: Import Meteorological data from the NOAA Integrated Surface Database (ISD) ‚Äî import_isd_hourly
text: David Carslaw

title: Import Meteorological data from the NOAA Integrated Surface Database (ISD) ‚Äî import_isd_hourly
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # import some data beijing_met <- import_isd_hourly(code = "545110-99999", year = 2010:2011)  # importing lots of data? use mirai for parallel processing mirai::daemons(4) beijing_met2 <- import_isd_hourly(code = "545110-99999", year = 2010:2025) } # }

title: Import
text: function alternative importNOAA(), provides access "Lite" format data. subset larger importNOAA() dataset featuring eight common climatological variables. assigns nearest measurement "top hour" data, specific values likely similar different returned importNOAA(). Read technical document information.

title: Import
code: import_isd_lite(   code = "037720-99999",   year = 2025,   progress = rlang::is_interactive(),   quiet = FALSE )

title: Import
text: code identifying code character string. code combination USAF WBAN unique identifiers. codes separated ‚Äú-‚Äù e.g. code = "037720-99999". year year import. can vector years e.g. year = 2000:2005. progress Show progress bar importing many stations/years? Defaults TRUE interactive R sessions. Passed .progress purrr::map() /purrr::pmap(). quiet Print missing sites/years screen? Defaults FALSE.

title: Import
text: Returns data frame surface observations. data frame consistent use openair package. Note data returned GMT (UTC) time zone format. Users may wish express data time zones, e.g., merge air pollution data.

title: Import
text: Note following units main variables: date Date/time POSIXct format. **Note time zone UTC may need adjusted merge local data. latitude Latitude decimal degrees (-90 90). longitude Longitude decimal degrees (-180 180). Negative numbers west Greenwich Meridian. elev Elevation site metres. ws Wind speed m/s. wd Wind direction degrees. 90 east. air_temp Air temperature degrees Celcius. atmos_pres sea level pressure millibars. dew_point dew point temperature degrees Celcius. precip_6 6-hour precipitation mm. precip_1 1-hour precipitation mm. sky Sky Condition Total Coverage Code. data returned GMT (UTC). may necessary adjust time zone combining data. example, air quality data available Beijing time zone set "Etc/GMT-8" (note negative offset even though Beijing ahead GMT. See openair package manual details), time zone met data can changed . One way attr(met$date, "tzone") <- "Etc/GMT-8" meteorological data frame called met. two data sets merged based date.

title: Import
text: importing lot meteorological data, can take long . combination year station requires downloading separate data file NOAA's online data directory, time download takes can quickly add . import_isd_hourly() import_isd_lite() can use parallel processing speed downloading , powered capable {mirai} package. users {mirai} "daemons" set, functions download files parallel. greatest benefits seen spawn many daemons cores machine, although one fewer available cores often good rule thumb. mileage may vary, however, naturally spawning daemons station-year combinations lead diminishing returns.
code: # set workers - once per session mirai::daemons(4)  # import lots of data - NB: no change in import_isd_hourly()! big_met <- import_isd_hourly(code = "037720-99999", year = 2010:2020)

what: Import station metadata for the Integrated Surface Databse ‚Äî import_isd_stations
title: Import station metadata for the Integrated Surface Databse ‚Äî import_isd_stations
text: function primarily used find site code can used access data using import_isd_hourly(). Sites searches approximately 30,000 sites can carried based site name based nearest locations based user-supplied latitude longitude.

title: Import station metadata for the Integrated Surface Databse ‚Äî import_isd_stations
code: import_isd_stations(   site = NULL,   lat = NULL,   lon = NULL,   crs = 4326,   country = NULL,   state = NULL,   n_max = 10,   end_year = "current",   provider = c("OpenStreetMap", "Esri.WorldImagery"),   return = c("table", "sf", "map") )

title: Import station metadata for the Integrated Surface Databse ‚Äî import_isd_stations
text: site site name search string e.g. site = "heathrow". search strings partial can upper lower case e.g. site = "HEATHR". lat, lon Decimal latitude longitude (Y/X coordinate using different crs). provided, n_max closest ISD stations coordinate returned. crs coordinate reference system (CRS) data, passed sf::st_crs(). default EPSG:4326, CRS associated commonly used latitude longitude coordinates. Different coordinate systems can specified using crs (e.g., crs = 27700 British National Grid). Note non-lat/lng coordinate systems re-projected EPSG:4326 making comparisons NOAA metadata plotting map. country country code. two letter code. full listing see https://www1.ncdc.noaa.gov/pub/data/noaa/isd-history.csv. state state code. two letter code. n_max number nearest sites search based latitude longitude. end_year help filter sites based recent available data . end_year can "current", "" numeric year 2016, range years e.g. 1990:2016 (select site end date range. default sites data current year returned. provider default map created readers may toggle vector base map satellite/aerial image. provider allows users override default; see http://leaflet-extras.github.io/leaflet-providers/preview/ list base maps can used. multiple base maps provided, can toggled using "layer control" interface. return type R object import ISD stations . One following: "table", returns R data.frame. "sf", returns spatial data.frame sf package. "map", returns interactive leaflet map.

title: Import station metadata for the Integrated Surface Databse ‚Äî import_isd_stations
text: data frame returned available meta data, mostly importantly including code can supplied importNOAA(). latitude longitude searches made approximate distance, dist km also returned.

title: Import station metadata for the Integrated Surface Databse ‚Äî import_isd_stations
text: David Carslaw

what: worldmet: Import Surface Meteorological Data from NOAA Integrated Surface Database (ISD) ‚Äî worldmet-package
title: worldmet: Import Surface Meteorological Data from NOAA Integrated Surface Database (ISD) ‚Äî worldmet-package
text: Functions import data 30,000 surface meteorological sites around world managed National Oceanic Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Integrated Surface Database (ISD, see https://www.ncei.noaa.gov/products/land-based-station/integrated-surface-database).

title: worldmet: Import Surface Meteorological Data from NOAA Integrated Surface Database (ISD) ‚Äî worldmet-package
text: package contains functions import surface meteorological data 30,000 sites around world. data curated NOAA part Integrated Surface Database (ISD). access data using worldmet package please give full acknowledgement NOAA ISD. Users also take note usage restrictions. data work well openair package developed analyse air pollution data.

title: worldmet: Import Surface Meteorological Data from NOAA Integrated Surface Database (ISD) ‚Äî worldmet-package

what: Export a meteorological data frame in ADMS format ‚Äî write_adms
title: Export a meteorological data frame in ADMS format ‚Äî write_adms
text: Writes text file ADMS format location user's choosing, optional interpolation missing values. present function works data import_isd_hourly(); later expanded work import_ghcn_hourly() also.

title: Export a meteorological data frame in ADMS format ‚Äî write_adms
code: write_adms(x, file = "./ADMS_met.MET", interp = FALSE, max_gap = 2)

title: Export a meteorological data frame in ADMS format ‚Äî write_adms
text: x data frame imported import_isd_hourly(). file file name ADMS file. file written working directory default. interp interpolation missing values undertaken? TRUE linear interpolation carried gaps including max_gap. max_gap maximum gap hours interpolated missing data interp = TRUE. Data gaps max_gap left missing.

title: Export a meteorological data frame in ADMS format ‚Äî write_adms
text: write_adms() returns input dat invisibly.

title: Export a meteorological data frame in ADMS format ‚Äî write_adms
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # import some data then export it dat <- import_isd_hourly(year = 2012) write_adms(dat, file = "~/adms_met.MET") } # }

what: Export a meteorological data frame in files, chunked by site and year ‚Äî write_met
title: Export a meteorological data frame in files, chunked by site and year ‚Äî write_met
text: Writes text file ADMS format location user's choosing, optional interpolation missing values. present function works data import_isd_hourly(); later expanded work import_ghcn_hourly() also.

title: Export a meteorological data frame in files, chunked by site and year ‚Äî write_met
code: write_met(   x,   path = ".",   ext = c("rds", "delim", "parquet"),   delim = ",",   suffix = "",   progress = rlang::is_interactive() )

title: Export a meteorological data frame in files, chunked by site and year ‚Äî write_met
text: x data frame imported import_isd_hourly(), import_ghcn_hourly(), import_ghcn_daily(). path path directory save file. default, working directory. ext file type use saving data. Can "rds", "delim" "parquet". Note "parquet" requires arrow package. delim Delimiter used separate values ext = "delim". Must single character. Defaults comma-delimited (","). suffix additional suffix append file names. Useful examples "_ISD", "_hourly", "_lite", . progress Show progress bar writing many stations/years? Defaults TRUE interactive R sessions. Passed .progress purrr::walk().

title: Export a meteorological data frame in files, chunked by site and year ‚Äî write_met
text: write_met() returns path invisibly.

title: Export a meteorological data frame in files, chunked by site and year ‚Äî write_met
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # import some data then export it dat <- import_isd_hourly(year = 2012) write_met(dat) } # }

title: worldmet (development version)
text: arrow added suggested dependency. leaflet downgraded suggested dependency. user requests met station map prompted install leaflet already installed.

title: worldmet (development version)
text: Global Historical Climate Network (GHCN) officially superseded NOAA‚Äôs Integrated Surface Database (ISD). Many changes release related external change. Added import_ghcn_stations(), import_ghcn_inventory(), import_ghcn_countries() grant access metadata GHCN. Added import_ghcn_hourly(), import_ghcn_daily() import_ghcn_monthly() grant access GHCNh, GHCNd CHCNm services. Added import_isd_stations(), import_isd_hourly() import_isd_lite() provide consistent API newly added GHCN functions. Added write_met(), allows hourly ISD GHCN daily GHCN data easily split years sites written file. flexible alternative using importNOAA(path=).

title: worldmet (development version)
text: Several functions deprecated replaced due updated worldmet API: getMeta() -> import_isd_stations() getMetaLive() -> import_isd_stations_live() importNOAA() -> import_isd_hourly() importNOAAlite() -> import_isd_lite() exportADMS() -> write_adms() path argument -> write_met()

title: worldmet 0.10.2
text: CRAN release: 2025-11-07

title: worldmet 0.10.2
text: worldmet longer depends openair.

title: worldmet 0.10.2
text: importNOAA() now recommends trying source fails fetch data (.e., source = "delim" fails, user prompted try source = "fwf").

title: worldmet 0.10.2
text: Fixed source = "fwf" failing importing data closed stations. Fixed source = "fwf" hourly = TRUE multiple sites imported. Removed present weather condition source = "fwf".

title: worldmet 0.10.1
text: CRAN release: 2025-08-20

title: worldmet 0.10.1
text: importNOAAlite() gained path argument, line importNOAA(). importNOAAlite() now supports parallel processing using mirai package, line importNOAA().

title: worldmet 0.10.1
text: importNOAAlite() can now import data years 2025.

title: worldmet 0.10.0
text: CRAN release: 2025-07-30

title: worldmet 0.10.0
text: Parallel importing NOAA data now powered mirai. reduces number dependencies worldmet, also allows users flexible parallel processing achieved. Due change, users recommended set mirai::daemons() . n.core stil work back-compatibility, give -per-session warning. getMeta() gained crs argument search NOAA ISD stations coordinates latitude longitude. Added importNOAALite() access ISDLite filestore. Added importNOAA(source=) argument import ISD data different file stores. option can useful one file stores available whatever reason. error warning messages now powered cli informative.

title: worldmet 0.9.9
text: CRAN release: 2025-01-14

title: worldmet 0.9.9
text: quiet argument importNOAA() now also toggles progress bar.

title: worldmet 0.9.9
text: getMeta() gained crs argument, allows getMeta(lat =, lon =) defined using coordinate systems.

title: worldmet 0.9.9
text: Fixed join problem due dplyr updates. Fixed spelling mistakes weatherCodes Converted worldmet vignette article. ensure longer reliant NOAA‚Äôs servers. can now accessed https://openair-project.github.io/worldmet/articles/worldmet.html.

title: worldmet 0.9.6
text: CRAN release: 2022-10-05

title: worldmet 0.9.6
text: importNOAA() now display progress bar multiple years met data imported. Improved formatting popups getMeta() line openairmaps::networkMap(). Added provider argument getMeta(), allowing users define one leaflet basemaps. Uses default openairmaps::networkMap(). exportADMS() now invisibly returns input data, line , e.g., readr::write_csv().

title: worldmet 0.9.5
text: CRAN release: 2021-04-20

title: worldmet 0.9.5
text: add precip exportADMS() Cloud cover data mostly spans 1 8 Oktas zero (clear sky); use ceil_hgt = 220000 (unlimited) indicate clear sky cloud cover reported missing. use ftp site information.

title: worldmet 0.9.4
text: CRAN release: 2021-04-09

title: worldmet 0.9.4
text: Fix precipitation. precip_12 gives sum precipitation past 12 hours sum column annual total mm. precip spreads 12-hour total evenly across previous 12 hours. worldmet longer tries combine 12 6 hour totals.

title: worldmet 0.9.3
text: CRAN release: 2021-03-29

title: worldmet 0.9.3
text: Catch missing data error report missing importing data using importNOAA()

title: worldmet 0.9.2
text: CRAN release: 2020-09-17

title: worldmet 0.9.2
text: Exporting weatherCodes everything works used packages ‚Äúexplicit namespacing‚Äù‚Äù (e.g. worldmet::importNOAA()) without library(worldmet).

title: worldmet 0.9.1
text: fix bug lat lon provided getMeta() fix bug several years selected columns different lengths n.core = 1

title: worldmet 0.9.1
text: Significant changes due NOAA storage formats different storage locations Remove options precipitation present weather importNOAA(); just return everything Return data tibble

title: worldmet 0.8.8
text: CRAN release: 2020-02-12

title: worldmet 0.8.8
text: export getMetaLive() allow users direct access meta data easy re-use without re-downloading. add option path allow users save met data rds file. deprecate fresh option getMeta(). Assume 9999 missing visibility (999999)

title: worldmet 0.8.8
text: fix short WBAN codes. make sure meta data used sites recent year

title: worldmet 0.8.4
text: CRAN release: 2018-02-27

title: worldmet 0.8.4
text: query live meta data using getMeta(). parallel processing sites years. use readr::read_csv() meta data (read.csv() seems slow R 3.4.3).

title: worldmet 0.8.4
text: fix bug data available year using parallel processing

title: worldmet 0.8.0
text: CRAN release: 2017-12-18

title: worldmet 0.8.0
text: downloads now webserver rather ftp. faster allow downloads. Thanks Stuart Grange. add parallel processing using foreach.
